HW_Parser.php

The first two lines are standard path detection. With a Parser module something else probably set this already but better safe than sorry.

The next block demonstrates standard include format (check first, use detected path). $CORE_LOCAL is an important global containing session values

check() looks for input the module can handle. In this case the module simply watches for the string "HW".

parse() demonstrates a couple options when the correct input is detected. If a transaction is in progress, it displays an error message. Otherwise, it sends the browser to a different display script.

N.B. the HelloWorld display module is just an example; that file does not exist in the gui-modules directory.

00001 <?php
00002 
00003 $CORE_PATH = isset($CORE_PATH)?$CORE_PATH:"";
00004 if (empty($CORE_PATH)){ while(!file_exists($CORE_PATH."pos.css")) $CORE_PATH .= "../"; }
00005 
00006 if (!class_exists('Parser')) include($CORE_PATH.'parser-class-lib/Parser.php');
00007 if (!function_exists("boxMsg")) include_once($CORE_PATH."lib/drawscreen.php");
00008 if (!isset($CORE_LOCAL)) include($CORE_PATH."lib/LocalStorage/conf.php");
00009 
00010 class HW_Parser extends Parser {
00011 
00012         function check($str){
00013 
00014                 if (strtoupper($str) == "HW")
00015                         return True;
00016 
00017                 return False;
00018                 
00019         }
00020 
00021         function parse($str){
00022                 global $CORE_LOCAL, $CORE_PATH;
00023 
00024                 $return_value = $this->default_json();
00025 
00026                 if ($CORE_LOCAL->get("LastID") != "0"){
00027                         $return_value['output'] = boxMsg("transaction in progress");
00028                 }
00029                 else {
00030                         $return_value['main_frame'] = $CORE_PATH.'gui-modules/HelloWorld.php';
00031                 }
00032 
00033                 return $return_value;
00034         }
00035 
00036 }
00037 
00038 ?>
